com.yantra.api.ycp.task

Interface createTask

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    YIFApi, com.yantra.api.YSCApi

    public interface createTask

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createTask(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The createTask API creates a task in the database.

    • Method Detail

      • createTask

        org.w3c.dom.Document createTask(YFSEnvironment env,
                                org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                         throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                java.rmi.RemoteException
        The createTask API creates a task in the database. Tasks are generated from several places in the application. When the system detects that there is a need to generate task, it calls the createTask API . The calling function also has the responsibility of ensuring that if a task requires to be completed in more than one step, it is accounted for. The createTask API does not have any logic of creating multiple steps. For each invocation of the createTask API, a single task is created. This API is supported only for RECEIPT, COUNT, PACK, VAS and SHIP kind of tasks.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This user exit is called before excuting any business logic. If input xml needs to be changed for any reason this can be done by this user exit.
        com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPBeforeCreateTaskUE

        Additional Information:
        /Task/StartNoEarlierThan
        /Task/FinishNoLaterThan
        The times entered in the StartNoEarlierThan or FinishNoLaterThan can accept any date value, such as 3:29. The recommended usage is to use hour increments, such as 3:00, 4:00, so that the display in the Task Management Console is clear and easy to read. Generally, there is no need to assign times at a per-minute level, though the createTask API can support this.
        Events Raised:
        This event is raised upon successful execution of this API.

          CREATE_TASK/TASK_CREATED:
          This event is raised upon successful execution of this api.
          Data published - YCP_CREATE_TASK.TASK_CREATED.xml
          Key data - task_dbd.txt

        Template Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

      Audits:
      An Audit is performed in YFS_TASK_STATUS_AUDIT for task status.

      Pre-conditions: None

      Post-conditions: None

      Output Template Support: Yes

      Database Extensibility Support: Yes

      Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document having latest task details and the audit details made to the task status on the platform. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
